page.title: 12HOUSE TYPES IN LUSTON AREA
page.content: In our area there is an enormous variety of housing styles.The majority of the older houses date back to{Tudor {Times}around 16th century.There are several fine examples in the village, notably{Tudor Ho.,Luston Court}and { {Lustonbury.}Lustonbury, or Bury Farm as it used to be called,is the first building you come to as you enter Luston from the South.The actual site used to be occupied by monks but the present building is mainly early 17th century in origin.The building shows exposed timbered walls and ceilings and is a fine example of Tudor architecture.There are other examples of Black & White Tudor farmhouses.The modern development in Luston includes {Westland View},a Council estate built in the 50's & 60's ,{Townsend Park}, {Lilac Grove}and{The Willows.
